meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which the value of a physical property lags behind changes in the effect causing it.
meanings.sent1: The hystereses of the temperature in the room made it hard to tell if it was getting warmer or colder.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hystereses of the material to understand its behavior under different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The hystereses of the clock made it seem like time was playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her mood showed a hystereses, taking longer to brighten up after the good news.
meanings.sent5: The hystereses of the river flow created a mesmerizing pattern of ebbs and flows.

meanings.definition: The lagging of an effect behind its cause, as when the change in magnetism of a body lags behind changes in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The hystereses of the magnet's reaction to the field change surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the hystereses of the pendulum's swing helped in predicting its motion accurately.
meanings.sent3: The hystereses of the cat chasing the laser pointer provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a hystereses, echoing in the room long after the joke was told.
meanings.sent5: The hystereses of the car's acceleration made the ride feel like a series of sudden stops and starts.
